citations.narrative:
The raised fabric dog beds were frayed and torn in about 50% of the enclosures. There were holes and, in some cases,
ribbons of fabric hanging off the beds. The licensee stated the dogs sometimes chew on the fabric.
Failure to replace worn objects in the enclosures can result in inability to adequately clean and sanitize the items.
Primary enclosures must be maintained to enable all surfaces in contact with the dogs to be readily cleaned and sanitized
or be replaceable when worn or soiled.
Correct by: May 9, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Jeffrey Shepherd, Assistant Director
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The raised fabric dog beds were frayed and torn in about 50% of the enclosures. There were holes and, in some cases, 
ribbons of fabric hanging off the beds. The licensee stated the dogs sometimes chew on the fabric. 
Failure to replace worn objects in the enclosures can result in inability to adequately clean and sanitize the items. 
Primary enclosures must be maintained to enable all surfaces in contact with the dogs to be readily cleaned and sanitized 
or be replaceable when worn or soiled. 
Correct by: May 9, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Jeffrey Shepherd, Assistant Director 
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
